contain.description: Resize an element’s content to stay contained within its container

cover.description: Resize an element’s content to cover its container

fill.description: Stretch an element’s content to fit its container

none.description: Display an element’s content at its original size ignoring the container size

scaleDown.description: Display an element’s content at its original size but scale it down to fit its container if necessary

square.description: This aspect ratio is often used for displaying square images or thumbnails, commonly seen in social media profile pictures, gallery grids, or icon grids.

widescreen.description: This aspect ratio is popular for widescreen displays and high-definition content, commonly used in modern television screens, computer monitors, laptops, and streaming platforms. It provides a wide and cinematic viewing experience.

standard.description: The standard aspect ratio is widely used in photography, digital displays, and video formats, providing a balanced and visually pleasing composition. It's commonly found in digital cameras, computer monitors, and older television screens.

fullscreen.description: This ultra-wide aspect ratio is often used for panoramic or immersive experiences, such as in cinemas, gaming monitors, and video editing workflows. It offers a wider field of view and enhances the cinematic experience.

portrait.description: This aspect ratio is ideal for displaying vertical or portrait-oriented content, commonly used in mobile devices, digital signage, and social media stories or vertical videos. It is optimized for a vertical viewing experience.

landscape.description: The landscape aspect ratio is widely used for displaying horizontal or wide content, such as photographs, websites, presentations, and multimedia content. It provides a wider field of view compared to the standard aspect ratio.

golden.description: This aspect ratio, derived from the golden ratio or divine proportion, is often used in art, design, and architecture for its aesthetically pleasing and harmonious proportions. It can be applied to various visual elements, including images, layouts, and compositions.

wideLandscape.description: This aspect ratio is used for displaying content with an extra-wide landscape orientation. It provides a wider viewing area than the standard widescreen aspect ratio (16:9), making it suitable for panoramic images, wide-format presentations, digital signage, and immersive video experiences. It offers an expansive and cinematic feel, allowing for more horizontal content to be displayed within the frame. This aspect ratio is often employed in industries such as film, gaming, virtual reality, and widescreen multimedia displays.
